Description: IELTS Reading Test with passage 'Undersea Movement'

Passages.PassageContent: The underwater world holds many challenges. The most basic of these is movement. The density of water makes it difficult for animals to move. Forward movement is a complex interaction of underwater forces. Additionally, water itself has movement. Strong currents carry incredible power that can easily sweep creatures away. The challenges to aquatic movement result in a variety of swimming methods, used by a wide range of animals. The result is a dazzling underwater ballet.

Questions.QuestionText: What is one of the main challenges of the underwater world?
The result of underwater movement is a ______ ballet.
